extendedIngredients.name: lime
extendedIngredients.originalString: Sliced lime and oranges for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: lime juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 18 ounces fresh squeezed lime juice (Could be fresh bottled lime juice from the refrigerated section, but not the concentrated kind. FRESH.)
metaInformation: (Could be bottled lime juice from the section, but not the concentrated kind. FRESH.)

extendedIngredients.name: sea-salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Course of flake sea salt for glass rims

extendedIngredients.name: simple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces simple syrup + a little extra for glass rims

recipes.title: Margaritas (Best Margarita )
recipes.instructions: Start by making the simple syrup if you don't have any on hand. Mix 7 oz. sugar with 7 oz. water. Microwave until the sugar has dissolved. You should have about 9-10 oz. so there will be a little extra for rimming the glasses.Now pour all the ingredients in a large pitcher. Stir well and chill.When ready to serve, pour the remaining simple syrup in a shallow dish. Pour sea salt in a second shallow dish. Then dip the glass rims in simple syrup, followed by sea salt. Add ice to the glasses if desired, and fill a shaker with ice.  Add the margarita mix to the shaker and shake for 10 - 15 seconds - pour into glasses.  Garnish the glasses with sliced limes or oranges and serve. Ole'!

steps.step: Start by making the simple syrup if you don't have any on hand.

Mix 7 oz. sugar with 7 oz. water. Microwave until the sugar has dissolved. You should have about 9-10 oz. so there will be a little extra for rimming the glasses.Now pour all the ingredients in a large pitcher. Stir well and chill.When ready to serve, pour the remaining simple syrup in a shallow dish.
Pour sea salt in a second shallow dish. Then dip the glass rims in simple syrup, followed by sea salt.
Add ice to the glasses if desired, and fill a shaker with ice.
Add the margarita mix to the shaker and shake for 10 - 15 seconds - pour into glasses.
Garnish the glasses with sliced limes or oranges and serve. Ole'!
